results.title: Living with disaster 2 : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description:
On the 3rd of June 2010, the residents of Lennox Head, on the North Coast of New South Wales, were preparing for the day ahead when their town was struck by a tornado. Despite having no warning, the tornado managed to pass without any loss of life but left over a hundred homes destroyed and hundreds more without power.

Nine residents of Lennox Head, mostly children, tell their stories about the disaster, revisiting the events of the morning leading up to the tornado and the chaos that followed. They speak frankly about the terror of the moment it hit and the way that day’s events have affected them since.

results.title: Miscarriage and stillbirth
results.creator_credit: Margaret Nicol, Tony Vuletich and V and A Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Understanding maternal grief”.
Miscarriage, although not uncommon, is a cause of deep grief and shock among women who have experienced it. With stillbirth, the grief often runs deeper for those women who are already mothers. In this video woman is interviewed who has experienced miscarriages and a stillbirth. Through her story we are able to understand more clearly the psychological needs of bereaved women and the resultant impact on women’s health when these are not met.

results.title: Infertility and adoption
results.creator_credit: Margaret Nicol, Tony Vuletich and V and A Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Understanding maternal grief”.
Infertility is perhaps the most unacknowledged and painful grief in our society - truly the death of a dream. While addressing major psychological issues encountered by infertile women, this programme also discuuses the option of medical intervention by outlining the benefits, the additional stress it can cause and the impact on relationships.

results.title: Neonatal death
results.creator_credit: Margaret Nicol, Tony Vuletich and V and A Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Understanding maternal grief”.
It is difficult to imagine the full impact of neonatal death on those women who are mothers for the shortest time. This video discusses the effects of the death of a baby on women’s mental and physical health. The grief process is viewed within the context of a wide range of stresses experienced by a woman and her fanily during this major life crisis including the impact of a premature birth: the stresses associated with having a seriously ill baby in neonatal intensive care: the difficulties in decision-making related to medical interventions: the consideration of siblings and their inclusion in the bonding and grief experiences.

results.title: Understanding maternal grief
results.creator_credit: Margaret Nicol, Tony Vuletich and V and A Productions
results.brief_description: A five part series introduced by Margaret Nicol, clinical psychologist and author which deals with distinct aspects of maternal grief. The programmes are dedicated to all women who have grieved over the loss of a baby and to the memory of those children. Each episode is designed to look at the experiences of women who have suffered different types of reproductive loss. The focus is on the need for the womens’ experiences to be validated and for the existence of the lost child to be acknowledged.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Nicol, Tony Vuletich and V and A Productions
results.description: A five part series introduced by Margaret Nicol, clinical psychologist and author which deals with distinct aspects of maternal grief. The programmes are dedicated to all women who have grieved over the loss of a baby and to the memory of those children. Each episode is designed to look at the experiences of women who have suffered different types of reproductive loss. The focus is on the need for the womens’ experiences to be validated and for the existence of the lost child to be acknowledged.

results.title: Loss of a baby: death of a dream
results.creator_credit: Margaret Nicol, Tony Vuletich and V and A Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Understanding maternal grief”.
This program addresses the issue of women’s grief following a reproductive loss. Reproductive loss is seen to encompass miscarriage, stillbirth, neonatal death, the birth of a handicapped baby and infertility. The video incorporates dicussion of the major psychological aspects of maternal grief with Margaret Nicol (Psychologist) and Dr. Howard Chilton (Neonatologist), along with interviews with bereaved women. The four bereaved women describe their journey in grief over many years, presenting those experiences which were helpful and unhelpful in this process.

results.title: The Birth of a handicapped baby
results.creator_credit: Margaret Nicol, Tony Vuletich and V and A Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Understanding maternal grief”.
Why? Why did this happen to me? This video looks at the grief reaction women following the birth of a disabled baby. Effects of long term stress and the impact of unresolved grief are illustrated through an interview with the mother of a teenage child born with severe disabilities.

results.title: The Big muster
results.creator_credit: Ben Burgandy, Lex Halliday and A M P Society
results.brief_description: Shows the rural holdings of the Australian Mutual Provident Society, and its contribution to the cattle industry in Australia. This is a record of the contribution the A.M.P. Society and its policyholders are making to the Australian beef industry. Shows pasture improvement on established properties, development of new pastures and marketing.

results.title: The Big if
results.creator_credit: Brent Walker Film Productions, Kamil Pixa, Peter Hollander, Kratky Film and United Nations
results.brief_description: An animated satire questioning what our money might be able to be used for if it was not spent on defence weapons. Animated by Boris Masnik.

results.title: The Birth of a brain : ten billion galaxies (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Claude Edelman, CRM/McGraw-Hill Films and Les Films du Levant
results.brief_description: Looks at the development of the human brain from embryo stage through to the first years of life. Computer graphics, sonography and film of living nerve cells show the process and progress of development at different stages. This is a version of a French documentary, ‘Naissance du cerveau : dix milliards de galaxies’ with a dubbed American commentary.
